agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Water & Rural Affairs TIME & DATE: 11:00 AM or upon adjournment Monday, May 6, 2019 PLACE: E1.012 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Charles Perry ** MEETING CANCELED ** SB 978 Hughes Relating to a study of the feasibility of converting quarries and surface mine pits for use as water storage reservoirs to enhance this state's available water supply. HB 191 Stephenson | et al. SP: Kolkhorst Relating to the disposal of pesticides. HB 1181 Guillen SP: Zaffirini Relating to the regulation of commercial catfish fishing on Falcon Lake. HB 1537 Shine | et al. SP: Buckingham Relating to the terms and election of the members of the board of directors of the Elm Creek Watershed Authority. HB 1574 Paddie SP: Hughes Relating to the composition of the Riverbend Water Resources District and the terms of the board of directors of that district. HB 1806 King, Tracy O. SP: Campbell Relating to the use of water withdrawn from the Edwards Aquifer by certain entities. HB 1824 Murr SP: Flores Relating to use of funds collected by the Parks and Wildlife Commission from the sale of certain materials. HB 2202 Miller SP: Kolkhorst Relating to the appointment and election of levee improvement district directors. HB 2305 Morrison | et al. SP: Kolkhorst Relating to a work group on enhancing the training and credentialing of emergency management personnel. HB 2340 Dominguez | et al. SP: Johnson Relating to emergency and disaster management, response, and recovery. HB 2729 Minjarez SP: Campbell Relating to the administration, duties, and operation of the Edwards Aquifer Authority; authorizing a fee. HB 2914 Bell, Cecil SP: Alvarado Relating to the necessity of hearings regarding the dissolution or conversion of certain conservation and reclamation districts. HB 3070 King, Ken | et al. SP: Zaffirini Relating to grants for emergency assistance under the rural volunteer fire department assistance program. HB 3366 Kacal | et al. SP: Kolkhorst Relating to the deposit and distribution by the Texas Racing Commission of certain pari-mutuel wagering funds to benefit the Texas-bred program. Public testimony will be limited to 2 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 10 copies to the committee clerk with your name and bill number on each copy. ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
